title: Marshall Free Pantry for Students
source_title: Marshall E-News | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content:
NOTES 

FROM 

OUR 

SOCIAL 

WORKER

NOTES FROM OUR SOCIAL WORKER

zoom_out_map
                






zoom_out_map

summary: The **Marshall Free Pantry** is located at the front left side of the school near the gym doors and is open to all students. The pantry offers **free food, hygiene products, and school supplies** including veggies, fruit, pasta, soup, applesauce, snacks, school supplies, body wash, shampoo, and toothpaste. For questions, donations, or suggestions, contact **Chrissy, Marshall Social Worker** at 513-273-3611 or rolfesc@talawanda.org.

summary: The **November 2025 breakfast and lunch menus** are now available for Marshall Elementary. The breakfast menu includes items like Mini Chocolate Chip French Toast, Breakfast Burritos, Pancake on a Stick, and various donut options. **100% fruit juice, assorted fruit selection, and milk are included with every breakfast.** The lunch menu features options such as Popcorn Chicken Dinner Roll, Mac & Cheese, Chicken Tenders, Pizza varieties, and a Holiday Meal with Roast Turkey and Gravy on November 19th. **Choice of milk is included with every lunch.** School is closed November 4, 24-25, and 26-28 for Thanksgiving break.

summary:
The **November 2025 breakfast and lunch menus** for Marshall Elementary are now available. 

**Breakfast** includes items like Mini Chocolate Chip French Toast, pancakes, breakfast burritos, and donuts. 100% fruit juice, assorted fruit, and milk are included with every breakfast.

**Lunch** features options such as Popcorn Chicken Dinner Roll, Mac & Cheese, pizza varieties, chicken tenders, and a special Holiday Meal with Roast Turkey and Gravy on November 19th. Choice of milk is included with every lunch.

School is closed November 4th, 24th-28th for Thanksgiving break. Menus are subject to change based on product availability.

summary: The **Marshall Free Pantry** is located at the front left side of the school near the gym doors and provides free food, hygiene products, and school supplies to all students. Available items include veggies, fruit, pasta, soup, applesauce, snacks, school supplies, body wash, shampoo, and toothpaste. For questions, donations, or suggestions, contact Chrissy, Marshall Social Worker at **513-273-3611** or **rolfesc@talawanda.org**.

title: Weather Reminders and Halloween Parade Information
source_title: Marshall E-News | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content:
NEWS 

& 

INFORMATION 

NEWS & INFORMATION

We had another wonderful week of learning and fun at Marshall! As the weather starts to get colder, we want to remind families to help students come to school prepared for outdoor recess. We go outside whenever possible, so please be sure your child has a warm coat, hat, or other layers to stay comfortable throughout the day. Mornings can be quite chilly, even if it warms up later, so sending a jacket or sweatshirt is always a good idea. Thank you for helping us keep students healthy, active, and ready to enjoy their time outside!Looking ahead, we‚Äôre excited to celebrate Halloween together next week! Our annual Halloween Parade will take place on Friday, October 31st, at 9:30 a.m. Grown-ups can drop students off as usual, then park in the upper lot and join us for some community fun before the parade begins. Enjoy free doughnuts and great conversation with other Marshall families, and grab a coffee or hot chocolate for purchase in the shelter. Everyone can head to the back lot around 9:25 to get ready for the parade kickoff. We can‚Äôt wait to see all the creative costumes and smiling faces!Sincerely,Mrs. Jones, Principal

summary: **Marshall Mondays** begin 10/20 - students should wear Talawanda gear, Marshall Elementary shirts, or red, white, and blue every Monday through the end of the year to show school spirit. As weather gets colder, please send students with warm coats and layers for outdoor recess. The **annual Halloween Parade** is Friday, October 31st at 9:30 a.m. - families can enjoy free doughnuts and purchase coffee/hot chocolate starting at 9:00 a.m., with the parade beginning at 9:25 in the back lot.

title: Marshall PTG Events and Fundraising Overview
source_title: Marshall E-News | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content:
PTG 

CORNER

PTG CORNER

summary:
The Marshall Parent Teacher Group (PTG) supports Marshall Elementary through community building and educational initiatives. **Current fundraisers** include Fall Mum Flower Sale, Glow Dance Party Boosterthon, Spring Flower Sale, and Box Tops for Education. 

**Upcoming events** for the 2025-2026 school year include:
- **Marshall Open House PTG Booth & Staff Luncheon** - Tuesday, August 12, 2025, 4:30-6:00 PM
- **PTG Marshall T-Shirt** sales
- **Back to School Family Skate** - Sunday, September 21, 2025, 3:00-4:30 PM
- **Fall Staff Conference Meals** - October 14 & 16, 2025
- **Back from Break Family Skate** - Sunday, January 11, 2026, 3:00-4:30 PM
- **Spring Staff Conference Meals** - March 12 & 17, 2026
- **Marshall Spring Fling Dance** - Friday, April 24, 2026, 6:00-8:00 PM
- **Staff Appreciation Week** - May 6-8, 2026
- **Mayfest** - Friday, May 15, 2026, 6:00-9:00 PM

PTG also supports field trips, R.A.H., general funding requests, and music receptions throughout the year.

title: Tech Healthy Household Presentation by Project Reboot
source_title: Marshall E-News | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content:
Project 

Reboot

Project Reboot

summary: **Project Reboot presents "Keys to Building a Tech Healthy Household"** on **Tuesday, November 18th from 6-7:30 PM at Talawanda High School**. This PSD-approved event features a 60-minute presentation plus 30 minutes of Q&A covering tech addiction (why it happens and how to overcome it), how to discuss screen time with kids without eye rolling, and practical tips for maintaining balanced relationships with technology. Hosted by Dino Ambrosi, Founder of Project Reboot ([https://projectreboot.school](https://projectreboot.school)), a digital wellness presenter who helped 100+ UC Berkeley students reduce screen time by an average of 3.5 hours per day. All attendees receive actionable take-home resources and dinner table discussion guides. Event supported by Greater Oxford Community Foundation.

title: Kiwanis K-Kids Food Drive for Local Families
source_title: Marshall E-News | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content:
AROUND 

THE 

COMMUNITY 

AROUND THE COMMUNITY

summary:
**Kiwanis K-Kids is hosting a food drive from Monday, October 20th through Friday, October 31st** to help feed local families in need. Donations will provide fresh meals and groceries to families who go to bed hungry each day.

**Items needed include:**
- Instant mashed potatoes (any flavor)
- Stuffing mix
- Gravy pouches
- Soup (cream of mushroom, cream of chicken)
- Canned vegetables (beans, corn, mixed vegetables)

**The class with the most donated items will win a pizza party!**

summary:
The **October 2025 breakfast and lunch menus** for Marshall Elementary are now available. 

**Breakfast** includes 100% fruit juice, assorted fruit selection, and milk with every meal. Daily options include items like egg & cheese bagel sandwiches, pancakes, breakfast burritos, french toast bites, biscuits & sausage gravy, and breakfast pizza. There is a **Fall Break with no school on October 17th**.

**Lunch** includes choice of milk with every meal. Daily options feature main dishes like chicken alfredo, chicken tenders, pizza, corn dogs, taco bites, quesadillas, chicken nuggets, and various sides including fresh vegetables, fruits, and salads. Special days include **Try It Tuesday on October 14th** and **National Apple Day on October 21st** with walking tacos and Doritos. **Fall Break continues October 17th, and Halloween is October 31st** with themed meals.

title: Touch-A-Truck Event Success at Marshall
source_title: Marshall E-News | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content:
THANK 

YOU!

THANK YOU!

We loved Touch-A-Truck! Students were absolutely thrilled to explore and learn about the many different vehicles that serve our community. From climbing into fire trucks to sitting in a police cruiser, exploring construction equipment, and even learning about everyday service vehicles, our kids had hands-on opportunities that they won‚Äôt soon forget.This event gave students a chance to not only see these big machines up close but also to connect with the people who drive and operate them each day. It was a wonderful learning experience that combined fun, curiosity, and community building. A huge thank you goes out to all of our community partners who brought their vehicles and spent the day sharing their time and expertise with our students. It truly was a great day of learning and excitement at Marshall!Thank you to all the wonderful people who volunteered to be here for Touch a Truck:Butler County Sheriff's DepartmentButler County Emergency Management AuthorityReily Township Fire DepartmentHanover Township Fire DepartmentButler County EngineerReffitt's Garage and Towing ServicesButler Rural Electric CooperativeRumpke Waste and RecyclingSterwerf TruckingZaenkert Surveying EssentialsPeterman Bus CompanySteve VizedomFancy Fur Dog GroomingShawna Dalton

summary: Marshall Elementary hosted a successful **Touch-A-Truck event** where students explored various community service vehicles including fire trucks, police cruisers, and construction equipment. Students had hands-on opportunities to climb into vehicles and meet the operators who serve the community. The school thanks numerous community partners who volunteered, including **Butler County Sheriff's Department, fire departments from Reily and Hanover Townships, Butler County Engineer, Reffitt's Garage, Butler Rural Electric Cooperative, Rumpke, Sterwerf Trucking, Peterman Bus Company**, and several other local businesses and volunteers.

title: RAH Reading Program Kicks Off October 1st
source_title: Marshall E-News | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content:
RAH 

üìö

RAH üìö
We will be kicking RAH off this year on WEDNESDAY, October 1st! Thank YOU for encouraging your students to read nightly and for all of your support for our RAH program!

RAH 

Info 

Letter

RAH Info Letter

summary:
The **Reading at Home (RAH)** program for the 2025-2026 school year begins **Wednesday, October 1st**. The program includes the entire school (K-5) and encourages students to develop a lifelong love of reading. 

Key details:
- **For every 25 books read**, students return a RAH Recording Sheet with parent signature to receive a book or prize
- **Two RAH sheets** can be collected per week
- **RAH cart days are on Wednesdays** (change from previous years)
- **First RAH recording sheet** is attached; extras available through e-news or from teachers
- Funded by Marshall PTC and Oxford Literacy Team

**Recording guidelines for 3rd-5th graders:**
- Picture book = 1 line
- Graphic novel = 25 pages = 1 line  
- Chapter book = 25 pages = 1 line
- Audio book = 25 minutes = 1 line

Contact: Mrs. Ziegler (zieglerk@talawanda.org) or Mrs. Birkemeier (birkemeierme@talawanda.org)

summary: This is a **RAH Reading List** tracking form where students can record up to 25 books they've read. The form includes spaces for the student's name, teacher name, and a checkbox at the top right. At the bottom, there are fields for parent signature and date to verify completion.
